00012 ## TODO documentation

00014 ## warning: the naming matters, see genobj -> uselib in generic.py

00020 #
00021 # Check for a function (e.g. usleep or strlcat) for which we have a replacement available
00022 # in kdecore/fakes.c (libkdefakes).
00023 # (This is a replacement for KDE_CHECK_FUNC_EXT)
00024 def CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(context, dest, function_name, header, sample_use, prototype):
00025         code="""
00026 %(header)s
00027 int main() {
00028         %(sample_use)s;
00029         return 0;
00030 }
00031         """ % { 'header' : header, 'sample_use' : sample_use }
00032         context.Message("Checking for function %s()... " % (function_name))
00033         ret = context.TryLink(code, '.cpp')
00034         if ret:
00035                 import string
00036                 dest.write("#define HAVE_%s 1\n" % (string.upper(function_name)))
00037                 context.Result(ret)
00038         else:
00039                 context.Result('ok - in libkdefakes')
00040                 dest.write("""
00041 /* No %(function_name)s function found on the system, kdefakes will provide it. */
00042 #ifdef __cplusplus
00043 extern "C" {
00044 #endif
00045 %(prototype)s;
00046 #ifdef __cplusplus
00047 }
00048 #endif
00049 """ % { 'prototype' : prototype, 'function_name' : function_name } )
00050         return ret
00051 
00052 
00053 ## TODO move to platform lowlevel.py
00054 ## DF: only the platform-dependent parts, right?
00055 def generate(env):
00056         if env['HELP']: return
00057 
00058         import sys
00059 
00060         #######################################
00061         ## other stuff
00062 
00063         if env['WINDOWS']:
00064                 env['CONVENIENCE']         = []
00065         else:
00066                 if sys.platform == 'darwin':
00067                         env['CONVENIENCE']         = ['-fPIC','-DPIC','-fno-common'] # TODO flags for convenience libraries
00068                 else:
00069                         env['CONVENIENCE']         = ['-fPIC','-DPIC'] # TODO flags for convenience libraries
00070 
00071         ########## zlib
00072         if env['WINDOWS'] and env['CC'] == 'cl':
00073                 env['LIB_Z']         = ['zlib']
00074         else:
00075                 env['LIB_Z']         = ['z']
00076 
00077         ########## png
00078         env['LIB_PNG']             = ['png', 'm'] + env['LIB_Z']
00079 
00080         if not env['WINDOWS']:
00081                 ########## sm
00082                 env['LIB_SM']              = ['SM', 'ICE']
00083         
00084                 env['LIB_DL']              = ['dl']
00085 
00086                 ########## X11
00087                 env['LIB_X11']             = ['X11']
00088                 env['LIBPATH_X11']         = ['/usr/X11R6/lib/']
00089                 env['LIB_XRENDER']         = ['Xrender']
00090 
00091         # tell it we do have a global config.h file
00092         env['_CONFIG_H_'].append('lowlevel')
00093 
00094         from SCons.Options import Options
00095         cachefile=env['CACHEDIR']+'lowlevel.cache.py'
00096         opts = Options(cachefile)
00097         opts.AddOptions(
00098                 ('LOWLEVEL_ISCONFIGURED', ''),
00099         )
00100         opts.Update(env)
00101 
00102         if not env['HELP'] and (env['_CONFIGURE_'] or not env.has_key('LOWLEVEL_ISCONFIGURED')):
00103                 env['_CONFIGURE_']=1
00104                 import sys
00105                 import os
00106 
00107                 ## Didn't generic.py do that already?
00108                 if not os.path.exists( env['_BUILDDIR_'] ): os.mkdir( env['_BUILDDIR_'] )
00109                 
00110                 ## The platform-independent checks
00111                 dest=open(env.join(env['_BUILDDIR_'], 'config-lowlevel.h'), 'w')
00112                 dest.write('/* lowlevel configuration */\n')
00113 
00114                 conf = env.Configure( custom_tests = { 'CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl' : CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl } )
00115                 ## TODO let the caller specify which checks they want? Hopefully not turning this into one-file-per-check though...
00116                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'setenv', '#include <stdlib.h>',
00117                                               'setenv("VAR", "VALUE", 1);',
00118                                               'int setenv (const char *, const char *, int)')
00119                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'unsetenv', '#include <stdlib.h>',
00120                                               'unsetenv("VAR");',
00121                                               'void unsetenv (const char *)')
00122                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'getdomainname', '#include <stdlib.h>\n#include <unistd.h>\n#include <netdb.h>',
00123                                               'char buffer[200]; getdomainname(buffer, 200);',
00124                                               '#include <sys/types.h>\nint getdomainname (char *, size_t)')
00125                 # TODO: does not work yet on mingw
00126                 if not (env['WINDOWS'] and env['CC'] == 'gcc'):
00127                         conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'gethostname', '#include <stdlib.h>\n#include <unistd.h>',
00128                                               'char buffer[200]; gethostname(buffer, 200);',
00129                                               'int gethostname (char *, unsigned int)')
00130                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'usleep', '#include <unistd.h>',
00131                                               'sleep (200);',
00132                                               'int usleep (unsigned int)')
00133                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'random', '#include <stdlib.h>',
00134                                               'random();',
00135                                               'long int random(void)')
00136                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'srandom', '#include <stdlib.h>',
00137                                               'srandom(27);',
00138                                               'void srandom(unsigned int)')
00139                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'initgroups', '#include <sys/types.h>\n#include <unistd.h>\n#include <grp.h>',
00140                                               'char buffer[200]; initgroups(buffer, 27);',
00141                                               'int initgroups(const char *, gid_t)')
00142                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'mkstemps', '#include <stdlib.h>\n#include <unistd.h>',
00143                                               'mkstemps("/tmp/aaaXXXXXX", 6);',
00144                                               'int mkstemps(char *, int)')
00145                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'mkstemp', '#include <stdlib.h>\n#include <unistd.h>',
00146                                               'mkstemp("/tmp/aaaXXXXXX");',
00147                                               'int mkstemp(char *)')
00148                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'mkdtemp', '#include <stdlib.h>\n#include <unistd.h>',
00149                                               'mkdtemp("/tmp/aaaXXXXXX");',
00150                                               'char* mkdtemp(char *)')
00151                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'strlcpy', '#include <string.h>',
00152                                               'char buf[20]; strlcpy(buf, "KDE function test", sizeof(buf));',
00153                                               'unsigned long strlcpy(char*, const char*, unsigned long)')
00154                 conf.CheckFuncWithKdefakeImpl(dest, 'strlcat', '#include <string.h>',
00155                                               'char buf[20]; buf[0]=0; strlcat(buf, "KDE function test", sizeof(buf));',
00156                                               'unsigned long strlcat(char*, const char*, unsigned long)')
00157                 # TODO finish (AC_CHECK_RES_QUERY and AC_CHECK_DN_SKIPNAME)
00158                 # TODO AC_CHECK_RES_INIT is a bit more complicated
00159 
00160                 env = conf.Finish()
00161 
00162                 ## The platform-dependent checks
00163 
00164                 if sys.platform == 'darwin':
00165                         sys.path.insert(0,'bksys'+os.sep+'osx')
00166                         from detect_lowlevel import detect
00167                 elif env['WINDOWS']:
00168                         sys.path.insert(0,'bksys'+os.sep+'win32')
00169                         from detect_lowlevel import detect
00170                 else:
00171                         sys.path.insert(0,'bksys'+os.sep+'unix')
00172                         from detect_lowlevel import detect
00173                 detect(env, dest)
00174                 dest.close()
00175 
00176                 env['LOWLEVEL_ISCONFIGURED']=1
00177                 opts.Save(cachefile, env)
